resources.string: In a lucid dream the dreamer is aware, that they are dreaming. Often the dreamer can gain some control over the dream and actively decide what to dream. Lucid dreaming is a learnable skill. This tutorial shows one way to learn it.

Whenever you wake up you immediately write down everything you remember. Don\'t forget little Details. Use the dream journal. Every entry stands for a dream (Sword = Lucid, Moon = Non-Lucid). In the long run this improves your ability to remember your dreams and makes it easier for you to recognize the dream state.

Every day you do about 10 to 20 reality checks. However you shouldn't plan them beforehand. Instead you should do them spontaniously in the moment. RCs consist of two parts. 

1. Ask critical questions (Why am I here? How did I get here? Who are these people? ...). If you can't find an answer or they don't make any sense, you are probably in a dream. 

2. After that comes a physical RC. There are many variations, but a simple one is: Pinch your nose and try to breathe through it. If you can still breathe you are probably in a dream. 

After two to three weeks, this should have become a habit (Caution: You still have to do it very consciously!). Because of that you will do it in the dream as well.
